skill.name: autonomous-ci
skill.description: Ensures Claude verifies both local tests AND remote CI before claiming completion. Use BEFORE any completion claims, commits, or pull requests. Mandatory verification with evidence.

skill.author: ANcpLua

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. The skill provides workflow documentation describing CI verification practices. All described operations (running local tests, using GitHub CLI) are standard devops practices with no data exfiltration, credential theft, or code execution risks. The skill file contains only markdown documentation.

content.value_statement: AI assistants often claim task completion without waiting for CI verification, leading to broken builds and false positives. This skill enforces a mandatory verification protocol that runs local tests, monitors remote CI, and requires evidence before any completion claims.
actual_capabilities: Runs local test verification (dotnet test, npm test, pytest, go test)
Commits and pushes code only after local tests pass
Monitors GitHub CI workflows until completion
Blocks progress until all CI checks pass
Downloads and analyzes CI failure logs
Reports success with evidence (URLs, timestamps, test counts)
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) to be installed and authenticated
Only works with GitHub Actions CI workflows
Does not support other CI providers (CircleCI, GitLab CI, etc.)
Cannot verify completion for repositories without test suites

use_cases.title: Prevent broken builds
use_cases.description: Stop CI failures from reaching main branch by enforcing verification before commits.

use_cases.title: CI quality gate
use_cases.description: Ensure all code changes pass complete CI pipeline before merge or deployment.

use_cases.title: Build verification habit
use_cases.description: Train AI assistants to verify work properly instead of making false completion claims.

prompt_templates.title: Quick verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Use autonomous-ci skill to verify completion. Run local tests, push code, and wait for all CI checks to pass. Report results with evidence.

prompt_templates.title: PR readiness check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run autonomous-ci protocol. Verify local tests pass, commit and push, then wait for CI completion. Do not claim PR ready until all workflows show success.

prompt_templates.title: CI failure recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: Download CI failure logs using autonomous-ci, analyze the root cause, fix the issue, and repeat the verification protocol until all tests pass.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-workflow project
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply autonomous-ci skill. Ensure ALL workflows (tests, lint, build) pass before reporting success. Provide URLs for each workflow run.

output_examples.input: Verify my fix is complete before committing
output: Work is verified complete and ready for merge.

best_practices: Always run the full verification protocol, even for small changes that seem trivial
Wait for ALL CI workflows to complete before claiming success
Download and analyze failure logs to understand root causes, not just pass/fail status
anti_patterns: Claiming completion after local tests pass without waiting for CI
Pushing code and assuming CI will pass without verification
Using 'should work' or similar speculative language instead of evidence-based claims

faq.question: Does this skill work with CI providers other than GitHub Actions?
faq.answer: No. This skill specifically uses GitHub CLI commands to monitor GitHub Actions workflows. Other CI providers require different tooling.

faq.question: What happens if CI takes a very long time to complete?
faq.answer: The skill uses gh run watch which blocks until completion. Claude will wait indefinitely rather than proceed without verification.

faq.question: Can I skip verification for documentation-only changes?
faq.answer: No. The skill enforces verification for ALL completion claims without exceptions, regardless of change type.

faq.question: Is my code or test data sent anywhere during verification?
faq.answer: No. The skill runs standard test commands locally and queries GitHub API for workflow status. No code or data is exfiltrated.

faq.question: What if my project has no test suite?
faq.answer: The skill requires a test suite. Projects without tests cannot use the full verification protocol effectively.

faq.question: How is this different from a simple pre-commit hook?
faq.answer: This skill enforces remote CI verification which catches environment-specific issues that local tests miss. Pre-commit hooks cannot monitor GitHub Actions.
